New Signing

Chelsea have given short-term academy scholarship contracts to three non-league teenagers and added them to their Under-18 squad.

Left-back Renedi Masampu, 17, was on the books of Isthmian Premier League side Metropolitan Police and had a trial with the Blues in May.

He played for Chelsea’s Under-18s in their win at Aston Villa on Saturday.

An unused substitute in that game was winger Adebambo Akinjogbin, 17, who has also signed. He had been with Brentford and Addlestone-based Abbey Rangers.

Fellow winger Tushaun Walters, also 17, has been affiliated with Millwall’s community and education arm.

Good morning! Antonio Conte's pre-match press conference will take place today at 1.15pm. We'll be bringing you live updates...ğŸ‘

Chelsea are lining up a second bid for Leicester City midfielder Danny Drinkwater after seeing an initial offer rejected.

The Blues want to make four signings by deadline day on August 31 and talks with Leicester over Drinkwater remain ongoing.

Chelsea have already had a bid rejected last week worth just under £20m and a second offer is imminent.

Leicester value the 27-year-old in excess of £30m, but Chelsea are not ready to meet that asking price yet.

Standard Sport understands the England international, who is close to full fitness after a minor thigh injury, is keen to make the move to west London.

Chelsea coach Antonio Conte is a huge admirer of the midfielder and believes he can make a major contribution this season despite already having Drinkwater's former Leicester team-mate N'Golo Kante, Cesc Fabregas and £40m summer signing Tiemoue Bakayoko to choose from to play in front of the back three.

Chelsea will have to spend considerably more than £20m to sign Southampton defender Cedric Soares this month.

Standard Sport first revealed in April that the Portugal defender is being lined up to compete with Victor Moses for the right wing back position this season and they are now stepping up their interest.

Chelsea are prepared to pay in the region of £15m-£20m for Soares, who still has three years left on his contract.

However, it is understood that Southampton will only consider selling should they receive a 'silly offer'.

In an exclusive interview with ESPN Brasil, Diego Costa has admitted that Atletico Madrid are not close to meeting Chelsea's valuation despite weeks of negotiations, and he knows he will have to change his plans if the Blues refuse to compromise.

"I've demonstrated I care for Atletico and have interest in playing for them," he said.

"But if Atletico and Chelsea don't come to an agreement and Atletico don't make a big effort, I can't keep on wanting to play for a club that isn't going to make a bigger effort to try and sign me.

"I know that this [big effort] will happen, but if it's to pay the amount that Chelsea want it won't be possible.

"What I know is that this offer Chelsea will get is bigger than what they paid [when they signed Costa from Atletico for £32 million in July 2014], so I've given them something back in all senses [sporting and financial]."
